issue.title: [CF 860] Not enough memory error.
issue.body:
Since WoW patch 5.4 was applied when i log in i get the following error message:
"Your computer does not have enough memory to load settings from the following addOn: Tellmewhen. Please disable some addons"
Tellmewhen seems to work normally, but it doesn't save any change to any icon and when i log in again all settings and icons are resetted to as they were before the patch.
This happens on every toon and profile.
I tried to disable all the other addons and leave only tellmewhen enabled but that didn't solve the problem.

My system specs: CPU: Intel i7920; RAM: 12GB; GPU: GeForce Gtx 560 Ti. Running on Win7 64.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Login or /reload ui.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
6.2.5

Do you have an error log of what happened?
Not getting any lua error.

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)
Other addons installed:

comments.body:
Attachment Added: TellMeWhen.lua

TellMeWhen.lua

<p>Account Saved Variable.</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user zabu1

Attachment Added: TellMeWhen.lua

TellMeWhen.lua

<p>From Cyb: Modified SV - try this</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user zabu1

Thanks for the report. I am unable to reproduce this on my system (i7 2600k, 12GB, win7x64). It is most certainly a flaw with the new system added by Blizzard in 5.4 whose purpose is to throw this error. I reported it to them in the thread here: http://us.battle.net/wow/en/forum/topic/9362996672?page=2#28

However, the system is certainly flawed because your settings are still being successfully loaded, so there is obviously no out-of-memory issue happening. You can't save your changes because the system is still flagging TellMeWhen to not write its saved variables on session close.

Try the saved variables that I just attached ("Modified SV - try this") - I removed some non-critical stuff so hopefully this will get around the error. If this doesn't work then I'm not sure where to go from here because this issue is at the mercy of Blizzard to fix. If you read the other replies in that thread, you can tell that something is definitely wrong, so hopefully it won't be log before they notice the issue and get it fixed.

Edited Sep 17, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Thank you for the swift reply and for the effort you're putting into keeping this addon working.

The savedvariable you posted didn't solve the problem sadly.

But looks like i found a way to kind fix it, surely not the most elegant way... I saved all my toons profiles to a string and deleted every tellmewhen related file from the WTF folder (both on account level and each toon's folder) ending up with fresh savedvariables. With an empty "out of the box" profile I didn't get any error, so i just re-imported my pre-patch profiles for every toon. So far not getting any error, and the changes are saved correctly.

As i said not really the most elegant and painless of the solutions, but thank god for the export profile function, at least i don't have to redo all my icons from scratch for every toon.


> Posted by CurseForge user zabu1

Marking as fixed since you have resolved the issue for yourself and there is nothing that I can do on my end - this one is all up to Blizzard to figure out.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
